prTitle: feat: implement useDrinks hook with TypeScript types and static drink data
prBody:
## Summary

- **`src/types.ts`** — Shared TypeScript interfaces: `Drink`, `Brand`, `Category`, `DrinkNutrition`, `DrinkCatalogEnvelope`, `ComparisonState`, `FilterState`
- **`public/data/starbucks.json`** — 31 Starbucks drinks across all 5 categories (hot, iced, blended, tea, other) with full nutritional data matching the `Drink` schema
- **`public/data/costa.json`** — 31 Costa drinks across all 5 categories with full nutritional data
- **`src/hooks/useDrinks.ts`** — React hook that fetches both JSON files in parallel via `Promise.all`, merges results by brand, applies `FilterState` (category + search query), and exposes `{ drinks, starbucksDrinks, costaDrinks, loading, error }`
- **`src/hooks/useDrinks.test.ts`** — 19 Vitest tests covering: initial loading state, parallel fetch, brand separation, category filtering (all 5 categories), case-insensitive search, combined filter+search, query trimming, and all error scenarios (network error, non-ok HTTP status for each brand)
- **`package.json` / `tsconfig.json` / `vite.config.ts` / `src/test-setup.ts`** — Minimal project infrastructure to run Vitest in a jsdom environment alongside the existing vanilla-JS mugs website

## Review Feedback Addressed

The prior review identified `mugs.json` still using `"price"` instead of `"price_usd"` and not using the versioned envelope format. Both issues were already resolved in the current codebase (`mugs.json` uses `price_usd` and the `{ version, mugs[] }` envelope throughout), so no further changes to `mugs.json` were needed.

## Testing

- `node app.test.js` — 23 tests pass (existing mugs website tests)
- `npm test` — 19 tests pass (new `useDrinks` hook tests)

Closes #44
